dataset.title: Investigating the influence of food on reproductive physiology: urbanization as a natural experiment

abstract.para: Timing reproduction to coincide with peak food abundance is considered one of the major adaptations of birds to local environmental characteristics. Consequently, food availability is a potent supplementary cue used to fine-tune breeding phenology. It is well known that greater food availability advances the onset of reproductive activity in seasonally breeding birds, whereas a paucity of food can delay reproduction, but the mechanism(s) by which the food availability in a geographical area leads to adjustments in reproductive physiology is poorly understood. The most consistent pattern emerging from studies of the effects of urbanization on birds is that urbanization is associated with advancement in breeding phenology. This project will use the disparity in resource abundance between urban and rural habitats in the Phoenix, Arizona CAP LTER study area as a natural experiment to examine the physiological mechanisms by which food availability affects the hypothalamo-pituitary-gonadal (HPG) axis. To accomplish this aim, I will dovetail morphological, immunohistochemical, and endocrine approaches in both the field and laboratory. Fieldwork will address the timing of reproduction initiation, and examine whether activity of neuropeptide Y (NPY) cells is a link between energetic status and the reproductive system. Laboratory studies will focus, in particular, on the neuroendocrine responses to differing food availabilities.

keywordSet.keyword: central arizona phoenix longterm ecological research

listitem.para: While CAP LTER will make every effort possible to control and document the quality of the data it publishes, the data are made available 'as is.'
CAP LTER cannot assume responsibility for damages resulting from mis-use or mis-interpretation of datasets or from errors or omissions that may exist in the data.
It is considered a matter of professional ethics to acknowledge the work of other scientists that has resulted in data used in subsequent research.
CAP LTER expects that any use of data from this server will be accompanied with the appropriate citations and acknowledgments.

CAP LTER encourages users to contact the original investigator responsible for the data that they are accessing. Where appropriate, researchers whose projects are integrally dependent on CAP LTER data are encouraged to consider collaboration and/or co-authorship with original investigators.
CAP LTER requests that users submit to the Global Institute of Sustainability, ASU, one copy of any publication resulting from the use of data obtained from this site.
CAP LTER requests that users not redistribute data obtained from this site. However, links or references to this site may be freely posted.

geographicCoverage.geographicDescription: (Default is the CAP LTER study area – see below. If your study area varies from this please edit accordingly.)

contact.organizationName: Global Institute of Sustainability, Arizona State University

publisher.organizationName: Arizona State University, Global Institute of Sustainability

listitem.para: Adult male Abert’s Towhees, Melozone aberti, using a mist net and playback of conspecific song. We determined sex and age by behavior (singing and territorial aggression only in males), skull pneumatization, and morphology (developed CP only in adult males, incubation patch only in adult females).

We measured wing chord (± 0.5 mm) and CP width (± 0.1 mm) using digital calipers. Body mass (± 0.5 g) was measured using a pesola spring balance. To quantify fat stores, we visually inspected the amount of furcular fat by assigning a score of 0 – 5 (a score of 0 representing no fat, 5 representing bulging fat deposits, Helms and Drury, 1960 Bird Banding, 31, 1-40).

We measured left testis length and width (± 0.5 mm) via unilateral laparotomy. Briefly, the bird was restrained to a working surface and the feathers on the left flank were dampened with 70% alcohol to move them out of the surgical field.

We swabbed the surgical field with betadine and then topically applied lidocaine anesthetic (Akorn, Lake Forest, IL, USA) before making a small incision between the last two ribs to expose the left testis. Testis length and width were measured by positioning the tips of forceps at each end of the testis. Volume of the testis was calculated from the formula for an ovoid sphere: V = 4 / 3 π(a^2)b, where V is volume, a is the radius of the testis at its widest point and b is half the long ++++.

We quantified plasma testosterone concentration using a commercial competitive enzyme-linked immunoassay, according to the manufacturer’s instructions (Enzo Life Sciences, Farmingdale, NY, USA). To assess immune performance, we quantified lytic and agglutination capacity using the hemoagglutination-hemolysis assay (following Matson et al. 2005 Developmental and Comparative Immunology, 29, 275-286).

project.title: Investigating the influence of food on reproductive physiology: urbanization as a natural experiment

abstract.para: This project tested two non-mutually exclusive hypotheses regarding variation in the timing of reproductive development between urban and non-urban Abert’s Towhees, Melozone aberti: the anticipation hypothesis, which posits that seasonal reproductive development begins in response to information from environmental cues that can forecast future conditions, and the constraint hypothesis, which posits that, within the window of opportunity for breeding determined by environmental cues, energetic status constrains the timing of reproductive development.

dataTable.entityName: Timing of reproductive development in urban and non-urban populations of a desert songbird
dataTable.entityDescription: Fieldwork data examines gonadal development and levels of testosterone, key reproductive hormone.

section.title: The GIOS Informatic Department Processed this data object with the following actions:

listitem.para: Data Processing Action: Replace empty, null's, /N, NAN's with NULL
Data Processing Action: Replace single quotes with Double quotes

attribute.attributeDefinition: Date of observation ; Unit: mm/dd/yy; Min: 8; Max: 9; Empty Values: Not Empty;

textDomain.definition: Unit Details: Range from 2/21/11 to 4/29/12; Unique Values: Can not be enum type; Notes: No further documentation;

attribute.attributeDefinition: Day of the year that the observation was made; Unit: Integer; Min: 29; Max: 120; Empty Values: Not Empty;

textDomain.definition: Unit Details: Days are number sequentially starting with January 1st as 1; Unique Values: Can not be enum type; Notes: No further documentation;

attribute.attributeDefinition: Site of capture; Unit: Text; Min: 3; Max: 4; Empty Values: Not Empty;

textDomain.definition: Unit Details: Four letter code for the site of capture.AGFR: Confluence of the Agua Fria and Gila RiversRPGI: The Riparian Preserve at GilbertASU: Arizona State University, Tempe campusPOBU: Powers ButteTEMP: Private residential yard in Tempe, close to the intersection of W. University Drive and S. Priest Dr.RISA: Rio Salado Habitat Restoration AreaHABU: Haydens ButteROBU: Robbins ButteIBWA: Indian Bend WashLOPI: Lopiano Habitat; Unique Values: AGFR,RPGI,ASU,POBU,TEMP,RISA,HABU,ROBU,IBWA,LOPI; Notes: No further documentation;

attribute.attributeDefinition: Classification of study site as either urban or desert; Unit: Text; Min: 1; Max: 1; Empty Values: Not Empty;

textDomain.definition: Unit Details: Either ‘U’ for urban or ‘D’ for desert (i.e., non-urban); Unique Values: D,U; Notes: No further documentation;

attribute.attributeDefinition: Measurement of a bird wing, bent at a 90 degree angle; Unit: Millimeter; Min: 87; Max: 96; Empty Values: Not Empty;
Body mass of the bird; Unit: Gram; Min: 44; Max: 53.5; Empty Values: Not Empty;
The time of day that the bird was caught; Unit: hh:mm; Min: 4; Max: 5; Empty Values: Not Empty;

textDomain.definition: Unit Details: Birds were captured using a mistnet and conspecific song playback; Unique Values: Can not be enum type; Notes: No further documentation;

attribute.attributeDefinition: A score of the bird’s fat store; Unit: Integer; Min: 1; Max: 4; Empty Values: Not Empty;

textDomain.definition: Unit Details: A visual score of the amount of fat stored in the furcular area. Score ranges from zero (i.e., no fat) to 5 (bulging deposits) and follows Rogers (1991) J. Field Ornithol. 62, 349–356.; Unique Values: 2,1,3,4,0,0.5; Notes: No further documentation;

attribute.attributeDefinition: Width of the bird’s cloacal protuberance; Unit: Millimeter; Min: 3.01; Max: 8.63; Empty Values: Not Empty;
Length of the bird’s left testis; Unit: Millimeter; Min: 3; Max: 8; Empty Values: NULL;
Width of the bird’s left testis; Unit: Millimeter; Min: 2; Max: 7; Empty Values: NULL;
Volume of the bird’s left testis; Unit: cubicMillimeters; Min: 6.28; Max: 205.25; Empty Values: Not Empty;
Plasma concentration of testosterone; Unit: nanogramsPerMilliliter; Min: 1; Max: 5; Empty Values: NULL;

textDomain.definition: Unit Details: Concentration of this hormone is measured using commercial competitive enzyme-linked immunoassay kits (purchased from Enzo Life Sciences). Blood samples were taken within 3 minutes of capture, so values represent baseline (i.e., pre-stress) levels; Unique Values: Can not be enum type; Notes: No further documentation;

attribute.attributeDefinition: The ability of Abert’s Towhee plasma to agglutinate foreign red blood cells; Unit: Decimal; Min: 1; Max: 4; Empty Values: NULL;

textDomain.definition: Unit Details: Ability is scored as the well on a 96 well plate containing the lowest plasma dilution capable of agglutinating sheep red blood cells. For more details see Matson et al. (2005) Dev. Comp. Immunol. 29, 275-286; Unique Values: Can not be enum type; Notes: No further documentation;

attribute.attributeDefinition: The ability of Abert’s Towhee plasma to lyse foreign red blood cells; Unit: Decimal; Min: 1; Max: 4; Empty Values: NULL;

textDomain.definition: Unit Details: Ability is scored as the well on a 96 well plate containing the lowest plasma dilution capable of lysing sheep red blood cells. For more details see Matson et al. (2005) Dev. Comp. Immunol. 29, 275-286; Unique Values: Can not be enum type; Notes: No further documentation;

stmml:unit.name: cubicMillimeters
stmml:unit.stmml:description: Standard unit for volume, just not in the lter standard unit list.
